thread.title: UPDATED: Ryanair and Hertz split in GDS disagreement
thread.title_full: UPDATED: Ryanair and Hertz split in GDS disagreement

title: UPDATED: Ryanair and Hertz split in GDS disagreement
text:
Ryanair is to seek damages from rental company Hertz after the car hire provider terminated an exclusive supply agreement. 
The Irish carrier alleges that the dispute stems from its agreement with GDSs. 
Ryanair contends that its GDS agreements have been in place for more than a year. 
All existing bookings will be honoured and customers can still amend their details. 
The two companies recently signed a contract extension, which took the exclusive deal though to 2020. 
Ryanair will be unable to offer customers car hire through its website for a period of three months until it finds a replacement supplier. 
Ryanair’s chief executive Michael O’Leary said: “We regret Hertz’s decision to end our car hire agreement at such short notice today, at a time that will cause maximum inconvenience to our customers during the peak travel period. 
“We have had a long and successful partnership with Hertz, and it’s a pity that this has ended in such an unfortunate and untimely manner. 
“We have instructed our lawyers to issue proceedings against Hertz for breach of contract.” 
The Hertz Corporation has said that despite lengthy discussions regarding a contractual dispute it has had to end its car hire agreement with Ryanair. 
Michel Taride, group president of Hertz International, said “We have enjoyed many years of a successful relationship with Ryanair, but unfortunately we were not able to reach agreement with the airline over a significant contractual dispute in spite of considerable effort. 
He added: “We are confident in our legal position and intend to pursue this matter vigorously through the courts.”
